subject: Re: [junit] Recompiling and reloading from GUITestRunner
msgSnippet: ... Which IDE? Why not just run the text-based test runner from your IDE? -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1
messageBody:
Chris Morris wrote:

> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> >Well, what's the real issue? Maybe we can come up with a cool solution.
> >
> >
> Nothing much -- just that I wanted to be able to tweak the test/prod
> code then Alt-Tab back to JUnit and hit Run and get a recompile plus
> execution, vs. staying in the IDE and compiling there first, waiting,
> then Alt-Tab, Run.

Which IDE? Why not just run the text-based test runner from your IDE?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
